course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A team is polishing a feature before any user has seen it. What is the risk?
options: Polish before proof wastes time; ship or test the minimal structure first
Users will love the polish when they see it
It will be faster to ship later
No significant risk in this case

questions.question: In this framework, how would you describe "ship the skeleton" in practice?
options: Build the minimal structure that could work; ship or test that first, then add detail after validation
Ship only wireframes and nothing else

questions.question: How do you identify the skeleton of a deliverable?
options: Ask: what is the minimum structure that could be tested or used?

questions.question: Confusing skeleton with "incomplete or shoddy work" can lead to:
options: Never shipping the skeleton and delaying learning

questions.question: Why add detail only after the skeleton is validated?
options: Detail after validation is efficient; detail before proof is waste
It has no effect on outcomes or learning

questions.question: After shipping the skeleton, what should you do?
options: Get signal; add detail only based on evidence

questions.question: What is the first step for a deliverable you are working on?
options: Strip it to the skeleton: the minimum that could be tested; ship or test that
